reviewText: ***SPOILER FREE REVIEW***If you were a fan of Napoleon Dynamite and the Big Lebowski, odds are you will like this film.  It is an atypical, quirky clever comedy that has very good acting, direction, and writing (warning, the film is R rated and will offend your sensibilities if the F-bomb and some quick nudity is too much for you).I had no idea what to really expect and was pleasantly surprised by the movie.  You can feel the chemistry between the actors, writers, director, cast, and crew.  You can tell this is a passion project and it shows.  The film is well done, entertaining, and all the actors (especially the lead) are extremely talented.I don't think this film will ever cross over well into the mainstream, but it should spur a few cults and become a cult classic.Lastly, a lot of negative reviews talk about this being for teenagers or that adults won't like it.  I think they completely miss the point and the jokes.  They would be the same people who would say Southpark is for teens just because it is a cartoon set in an elementary school.  Sure, teens should like it, but it is clearly meant for adults and the humor works (i'm in my 30s FWIW).p.s.  Even though I liked the film and think it is a good film, I don't see how you can give it 5 stars.  I'd probably rate this movie 3.5 stars but since Amazon hasn't been able to master the half star I gave it 4 stars.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watched this not expecting much, but I found it to be hilarious. At times the characters are a bit unbelievable, but it all lends itself to comic genius. There are many times in this movie where I laughed uncontrollably, I really loved the writing and the acting. The concept is very original (though the part where the group has a falling out is a common cliche), and they really follow through with it; not pulling any punches. I'm not sure how well the jokes will stand up to multiple viewings, but I think any fan of comedy movies should check out Mystery Team.

reviewText: A comic friend of mine rave (and rave) about this film (calling it amazing and brilliant among other things).  I also noticed there were a ton of five star reviews on this page.  After some investigation, it turns out that many of those five star reviews were done by people who just reviewed Mystery Team and have never reviewed another film on this site.  Were they so deeply moved by the brilliance of Mystery Team to review it, or was it that someone in connection with the film itself was just hyping their own movie by posting five star reviews under different names?  Regardless, I decided to check it out.Boy, do I regret that decision.This is a really bad, lame, amateurishly scripted "comedy" with a few mild chuckles at best.  To call this tripe amazing, hilarious, and brilliant is an insult to actual films that are brilliant, amazing, and hilarious.  Any of John Waters's early work, the Naked Gun movies, Python, Chappelle, etc., etc., can run rings around this film.  This film got a lot of buzz on the festival circuit (mostly SXSW and Sundance), but like many hyped indie films, it's a really big disappointment.Don't waste your time.
summary: Immensely lame....and not the greatest comedy ever made as some reviewers are inferring....

reviewText: Questions:(1.) Why do 90% of the positive reviews begin with "I"? What does that suggest?(2.) Why are 90% of the positive reviewers pre-teen males?(3.) Why is there no story that makes any sense? Well unless it's very ho-hum cliche of corporate greed at expense of killing the town's folk?(5.) Acting? Well, looks like it from a seven year old's perspective.Suggestion:(1.) Only one. See (2.)(2.) Instead of "Mystery Team" see "Kickass" so many times that you're so satiated with watching anything that you never want to watch another movie again and with your last viewing gasp you will still have seen an immeasurably superior production.

reviewText: I enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if a choice had been made whether to make a clever movie or a vulgar movie. It kept flip flopping and thus doesn't really play well to either audience. A lot of good stuff, though - good performances, some really clever bits. The sound when I saw it  could have still used a little bit of clean-up as well; kind of bright and a bit inconsistent. Not bad, mind you, just not 100% professional. Perhaps it's been cleaned up for DVD/Blu-Ray.
summary: Fun but seems to try playing to two different audiences

reviewText: I could not stop laughing.  This movie not only is it funny but it has a great plot.  Basically, you have a group of teenagers(seniors in high school) who solve mysteries involving six year olds kids but want a case to take them to the big time.  So, the team gets a call from a six year girl who parents have been murder.  The situations the mystery team get involved are funny.  One scene, they are following a person of interest into a gentleman club and have not idea what is inside the club(hey, ladies).  If you are having a bad day or just want a good laugh you must see this film, you will not regret it or forget it.
summary: This is one CRACK UP COMEDY!!!!!!

reviewText: Donald Glover is hilarious on Community; but there unfortunately just aren't that many laughs to be found here.I've since watched some of the Derrick Comedy YouTube videos and I can't say they are very good either. My best guess is that it may have to do more with the writing than anything else. I'm afraid the best I can rate this is a 3/5 for OK. It's a great concept, especially if you were a fan of The Three Investigators Mystery Series created by Robert Arthur, Jr. when you were growing up. Sadly, the jokes just aren't that funny and the situations just not that original.

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: This is an odd ball over the top, laugh out loud original comedy. Three high school boys who do not know the facts of life operate a dime stand kids detective agency. Jason (Donald Glover) is the master of disguises. He is a naive, nerdy, non-street smart Axel Foley. Duncan (D.C. Pierson) is the brains of the group because in the second grade he memorized a book of trivia. Charlie (Dominic Dierkes) is the muscle in the group, because he thinks he is tough.They ride bicycles with white wall tires and communicate with walkie-talkies. When an 8 year old girl hands them a dime and asks them to find out who killed her parents, our heroes get way over they head as the comedy becomes non-stop. The trip to the gentleman's club was the funniest scenes in the film. Think of it as Napoleon Dynamite for adults.PARENTAL GUIDE: F-bombs, sex talk, nudity.
summary: I HEAR THE MINK IS VERY GOOD HERE

reviewText: 5 stars really?  I must have watched a different film than the others.  This was undoubtedly the worst movie I have ever rented.  It was a complete waste of time and money.  It was painfully awful and the longer I watched the more disappointing it got.  I think I may have chuckled once, but not loud enough for anyone to notice. The best way to describe this film is GUY HUMOR!! No offense boys, but I bet the people giving this film 5 stars were guys between the ages of 16-30. If you like the mix of boyish silly and crude comedy, you might enjoy this.  Otherwise, stay away!!!

reviewText: Saving the World from SEX, DRUGS & SWEAR WORDS? How about: Littering the World with SEX, DRUGS & SWEAR WORDS! Playground kids dropping F-Bombs...Gross-out gags...Acting on par with the old "Land of the Lost" Saturday morning tv series. This movie must have the narrowest of narrow target audiences, EVER. It's KIDS solving "mysteries" in their neighborhood, yet any parent who allows a pre-teen child to watch this unique portrayal of vulgarity needs parental counseling. And any grown-up watching KIDS solve neighborhood mysteries probably flunked their most recent drug test. So that leaves the group that just turned 18, left mom & dad's home and discovered they can say the F-word whenever and wherever they like, plus the YouTube Groupies. Obviously there's quite a bit of overlap between these two groups. Like I said: Narrowest of narrow target audiences...The story has merit, but it's quickly extinguished by horrendous acting and an obvious low budget. The first 30 minutes or so are OK with a few jokes/gags that work...But after they visit the drug dealer, everything becomes so 3-Stooges-like (without the 3-Stooges) and barely watchable. Perhaps the premier acting performance was Matt Walsh playing the guy at the office party who has too much to drink - haven't we all worked with that guy at least once? I really tuned in to his character right up to the point where he tells his co-worker buddy: "Sometimes I wish you didn't beat cancer...I really do." Just inappropriate and exceedingly awkward, even for a movie performance. It makes you wonder if joke subjects are in such short supply that troupes like Derrick Comedy feel forced to try and squeeze laughs out by making poor-taste, insulting "jokes" about a truly horrendous disease that has tormented so many people. Can't these guys afford to hire a decent editor who would axe something like this out as Job #1?In another scene, the kids are trying to get into a strip club to search for clues. When the bouncer asks for IDs, one produces a library card, another a high school ID card and the third a folded up drawing of a hammerhead shark. Anyway, the bouncer lets them in...Yeah, funny stuff, right? If this kind of thing gives you belly laughs, then you're in luck...Because the whole movie is basically over-the-top ridiculousness with 8-year olds dropping F-bombs, the N-word and P-word, mixed in with vomit gags and toilet humor. Pretty much a stoner's dream come true! For the rest of us, there are thousands of better ways to spend $20 and 97 minutes that you'll never get back. Choose wisely and RENT Mystery Team first...If you must.Maybe the sequel can be: "Mystery Team: The Case of Why So Many 5-Star Reviewers of This DVD Have Only ONE Amazon Review To Their Credit"...
summary: Definitely NOT For Kids...Probably Not For True Adults Either.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "The whole idea of searching for a mysterious situation in the occurrence has been the vein of many Hollywood tales and novels but Derrick Comedy (Donald Glover or Childish Gambino's invention) remains to follow a more comical approach toward the subject. The film as a whole however makes light of its murder plot but suffers as a whole in being consistent, paced, and sometimes humourous instead going with an interesting indie/hipster approach to the film (as found in films like Youth in Revolt, Nick & Norah, and Clerks). Mystery Team isn't bad but it lacks the kind of biting edge, striking humour, or visuals normally found in most comedies because it relies on a certain lack of realism, often being quite predictable, too simple, and cheap in its set designs but at times this works in the film's favour. The saving graces are apparent though as it features a good enough structure, unique plot, Glover and Plaza's performances, and old-school vibe that reminds you of how long comedies come since the heydays of the bawdy '80s films like The Blues Brothers, Caddyshack, Wayne's World, and Revenge of the Nerds. If you ever feel like all comedies are same old, sex-crazed ones these days featuring only SNL cast members and if you're bummed from university coursework, why not try Mystery Team or other works like Scott Pilgrim or The Watch (comedies out of the current norm in Hollywood). It might make your stoner self cringe and yell in crying laughter."
summary: Do not expect too much other than a fine exercise in college-oriented comedy
Title: N/A
